_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The McGregor Compnay
Ritzville Chemicals
Ritzville, Washington

1. Facility Policy
The managament and employees of The McGregor Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of aqua ammonia through the use of proper equipment, regular inspections, maintenance and training of all persons that work with aqua ammonia. Should an accidental release occur, this facility has worked with the local fire department and local emergency planning committee so they can plan for response to a realease and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information
The primary activity at this facility is the storage, and handling of aqua ammonia for sale to farmers. Aqua ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application to the soil as a crop production nutrient.

3. Worst-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario
This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario; however, it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.

4. Accidental Release Program
This facility complies with various rules and regulations govering the storage and handling of aqua ammonia including ANSI K61.1, OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 and regulations administered by our state agency. Training is provided on safe aqua ammonia operations for employees.

5. Five-Year Accident History
There have been no accidental releases of aqua ammonia for this covered process at this facility in the past five years.

6. The Emergency Response Program
The facility has a written emergency plan in accordance with OSHA standards 29 CFR 1910.38 and 29 CFR 1910.120. Emergency planning and community right-to-know information is provided to state emergency response commission, local emergency planning committee and local fire department as required by SARA Title III of EPCRA.

7. Planned Changed to Improve Safety
Safety improvement is an on-going

process at this facility. Periodic inspections and evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations. There are no additional specific aqua ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
